thread.title: Kansas City Royals defeat Houston Astros 7-2 in Game 5: MLB Playoffs 2015 recap
thread.title_full: Kansas City Royals defeat Houston Astros 7-2 in Game 5: MLB Playoffs 2015 recap | OregonLive.com

author: JD Humburg | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Kansas City Royals defeat Houston Astros 7-2 in Game 5: MLB Playoffs 2015 recap
text:
The Kansas City Royals have come from behind, down 2-0 initially, and defeated the Houston Astros 7-2 in Game 5 of this best-of-five American League Division Series in Kansas City. Recap the game with our live updates, photos and video highlights that appear in the comments section provided below .
Here's a quick look at what happened in each inning:
9th Inning - Wade Davis comes in to close out the game for Kansas City in the top of the 9th and he makes quick work of the Houston Astros as the Royals close out the game and win to advance in the MLB Playoffs.
8th Inning - A pop out and two ground outs ends the top half of the inning for the Astros. They will have one last chance to even this game or go-ahead in the top of the 9th. Dallas Keuchel comes in for Houston to try and close out the 8th, but he doesn't look sharp. 2 runners on base for KC. Kendrys Morales takes advantage and yaks a 3-run home run. Royals now lead the Houston Astros 7-2.
7th Inning - Houston is making another pitching change. Pat Neshek coming to the mound and he gets them off the field and bak to the plate. We head to the 8th inning.
6th Inning - Astros go 3-up, 3-down in the top half of the inning. Royals go 3-up, 3-down in the bottom half of the inning.
5th Inning - Houston's Collin McHugh looking shaky now... he hits Perez and puts a runner on at first for Kansas City. Alex Gordon hammers a pitch off the warning track for a ground-rule double that stops KC short of scoring a run. McHugh comes off the mound as Houston will make a pitching change. Mike Fiers will take the mound with runners on 2nd and 3rd and no outs. Tough spot for the Astros. Next batter is Alex Rios and get lines a ball just fair down the 3rd base line for a double that scores two. After a sacrifice fly scores Alex Rios, KC now leads Houston 4-2.
4th Inning - At the plate, the Royals finally find some traction. Lorenzo Cain singles to right, then Eric Hosmer gets a bloop to center that's corralled late by Astros center fielder Carlos Gomez... as a result of Gomez falling down on the play, Cain beats feet and scores from first base on the play to cut the deficit to 2-1 in favor of the Astros.
3rd Inning - Johnny Cueto having to make a lot of pitches so far to get outs, but he escapes the top half of this inning unharmed. For KC at the plate, they get a man on to lead off the inning, but the scoring chance is dashed on a double-play.
2nd Inning - The Astros' Evan Gattis gets on base at first base after Mike Moustakas throw isn't there in time. Next batter is Luis Valbuna. Valbuena with an incredible swing changes this game. He sends a hard shot to right field that launches out of the park for a 2-run home run that puts Houston up 2-0.
1st Inning - Johnny Cueto on the mound for Kansas City. He gets the Astros to go 3-up, 3-down with one strikeout among the three hitters. Royals at the plate facing Collin McHugh, and he gets an out and then puts a man on with a walk before the next batter hits into a double play to end the 1st inning.
Here are the details you need in case you want to watch the game on TV, or online:
What : Houston Astros at Kansas City Royals in ALDS Game 5. Series tied 2-2.
Where : Kauffman Stadium, Kansas City
When : Wednesday, October 14, at 5:07 p.m. PT/8:07 p.m. ET
What TV channel : TV on Fox Sports 1, radio on KMTT (910 AM) in Portland area
Watch and listen online : Watch online at Fox Sports Go . Listen at ESPNRadio.com .
Pitching matchup : Houston's Collin McHugh vs. Kansas City's Johnny Cueto
Playoff schedule : Bookmark our MLB scoreboard for postseason scores and schedules.
